title: Drawing, "Achilles Yields Briseis", ca. 1790
medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on light blue laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: Achille perde briseide per la salute de greci
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Achilles shown sitting before his tent, filled with anger. Patroclus delivers maiden to two messengers of Agamemnon. Part of sailing ship shown in right middle plane.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Achilles Yields Briseis", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on light blue laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3291.
